**under development (both me and the website)

Ajit Srikanth

I am a Pre-Final year B.Tech with MS by research (dual degree) student at IIIT-Hyderabad. I'm currently an undergraduate researcher at the Robotics Research Center (RRC) @ IIIT-Hyderabad, advised by Prof K. Madhava Krishna.

Email  /  GitHub  /  Google Scholar  /  LinkedIn  /  CV

Supplimentary

I'd like to say I work on robot learning. My long-term research goal is to create agents which can learn from their (or some other embodiment's) prior experiences to perform tasks, and also being able to adapt to new tasks (and environments), without task-specific data.

Although a bit cliche, I wish to work towards where humans and robots coexist, with the robots assiting humans not only in dangerous tasks, but also boring (subjective) everyday tasks like cleaning, cooking, fetching, blah blah blah. Well, this will also enable them to serve as support systems for humans and also scale up accessibility to resources.

Feel free to reach out to me to for any discussions, collaborations or just to say hi. Most of my social media handles are just "ajitsrikanth" (without the ""). I'm always down for an intresting conversation. If you dont know what to talk about, we can talk about Robotics in general, Robot Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Motion Planning, Foundation Models, Computer Vision, Deep Learning / ML, Computer architecture, Hardware acceleration, any cool math theorms / neat proofs, physics (feel free to go wild with your theories), tennis, cricket, most other sports, movies (any genre works), anime, world domination(?), or literally anything.

Publications
(* denotes equal contribution. Click on publication to view more)

GPD: Guided Polynomial Diffusion for motion planning


Ajit Srikanth*, Parth Mahajan∗, Kallol Saha∗, Vishal Mandadi∗, Pranjal Paul, Pawan Wadhwani, Brojeshwar Bhowmick, Arun Singh, and Madhava Krishna

Kallol Saha*, Vishal Mandadi*, Jayaram Reddy*, Ajit Srikanth, Aditya Agarwal, Bipasha Sen, Arun Singh, Madhava Krishna

Projects

(Click on project to view more)

ASAC- Assisted Spatial Audio Construction


project
  • Automatically generating spatial audio (like Dolby Atmos) for scenes in movies/videos using video understanding. Designed a system that handles complex multi-speaker environments, identity switching and occlusions by leveraging lightweight tracking and facial recognition methods.
  • Currently working on using scene understanding to generate better spatial audio even in the absence of proper visual cues.

Contract-NLI


project
  • Proposed an alternative BERT-based architecture to Contract-NLI-BERT, for performing NLI and Evidence inference for Legal contracts.
  • achieved a minor performance boost over the baseline attributed to the changed architecture which improves the handling long-term dependencies between evidence-spans.

Autonomous Omni-drive robot


project
  • Assembled a mecanum wheel robot with four Orange Planetary Gear DC Motor driven by two Cytron Mdds30 Dual 30A drivers
  • Integrated the Realsense T265 tracking camera and Realsense D455 depth camera along with voxfield for getting ESDFs
  • Implemented multiple planning algorithms (on the onboard intel NUC) including CEM, MPPI, and MPC using the ESDFs generated, and implemented basic PID for following the path generated

8 legged Klann walker robot


project
  • Designed a walker robot with 8 klann linkage mechanims for legs, along with complete kinematics and dynamics analysis with consideration for different gaits for different purposes, on Fusion360.
  • Fabricated and assembled the designed mechanism by laser-cutting acrylic sheets for the links, chassis and 3D printed the joints and couplers.
  • Wrote a simple controller to control the two dynamixel XL330 motors using U2D2 for communication.

Object centric pose reconstruction


project
  • Designed a complete pipeline for 3D reconstruction of an object using a monocular fixed camera.
  • Used ICP, Bundle adjustment and a few pose graph optimization methods.

Single image dehazing methods


project
  • Implementation of various haze removal and simultaneous depth extraction methods including Bayesian defogging, Single image haze removal using Dark Channel Prior, Single image haze removal using Colour Attenuation Prior.
  • Improved upon the DCP prior paper, by adding an additional preprocessing step which increases the restored image quality by utilizing CLAHE.
  • Extensively benchmarked these algorithms along with other classical methods without a degradation model, and analyised their performance.

Y86 ISA Processor


project
  • Designing and implementing sequential and pipelined Y86 ISA Processor in iverilog.
  • proper handling of data, structural, and control hazards.
  • A very basic compiler using python for converting Y86-64 assembly code to machine code for that processor.

Teaching

  • I taught two lectures at for the course CS7.503 Mobile Robotics (Monsoon 2024) at IIIT-Hyderabad by Prof. K. Madhava Krishna, where I covered the basics of Transformations and Quaternions representations, and then ICP slam.
  • I served as a teaching assistant for the course EC2.204 Intro to Processor Architecture (Spring 2024) at IIIT-Hyderabad by Prof. Deepak Gangadharan, with around 100 students, where I prepared assignments, and conducted tutorials on topics including: Verilog HDL programming, X86 ISA, Sequential and pipelined architectures and hazard handling. Further, I helped design and mentor the students for the final project, which was to design a Y86 ISA pipelined processor, with proper branch prediction and hazard handling.


Design and source code from Jon Barron's website
